alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 7:12PM MST until July 28 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY IN THE MAYER AREA... At 707 PM MST, the public reported thunderstorms producing flooding in Big Bug Creek at Mayer. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen over the drainages west and south of Mayer. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mayer, Cordes, Spring Valley, Cordes Junction and Cordes Lakes. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 263 and 272. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Government Spring Wash, Pine Creek, Turkey Creek, Minnehaha Creek, Tuscumbia Creek, Mineral Creek, Agua Fria River, Poland Creek, Grapevine Creek, Little Wolf Creek, Wolf Creek, Ash Creek, Big Bug Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
